intro: Fimbristylis laxa, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, leaf-like stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Fimbristylis laxa typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its delicate appearance and ecological adaptability make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
